title: Breakthrough in Schizophrenia Treatment: Karuna Therapeutics’ New Drug Under FDA Review
text:
- Eli Lilly may come up with a new treatment for Alzheimer’s disease.
- FDA is reviewing CRISPR technology for blood disorders.
- Karuna Therapeutics improves existing antipsychotics on the market.
2023 was a big year for medicine, with drugs for Alzheimer’s disease, weight loss and the first treatment based on CRISPR gene editing
technology.
2024 is also proving to be a landmark year.
What to expect in the medical field in the new year?
There are many drugs in development, but we will talk about one that could treat one of the most common mental illnesses in Romanians: schizophrenia. The FDA will review a new drug treatment for schizophrenia — the first for the condition in decades.
Karuna Therapeutics has improved existing antipsychotics by targeting a different brain chemical than existing drugs, which focus on dopamine.
The studies are…confident
In a study of several hundred people with schizophrenia, the drug, which acts on receptors in the brain involved in regulating positive and negative thoughts, helped reduce the extreme symptoms typical of this condition.
If approved, the drug could help more people relieve their worst symptoms, as many of them stop taking existing drugs because of their side effects.
But as exciting as these new drugs are, they also raise questions about affordability.
